page.title: 06Scottish Museum Anstruther
page.content: The Scottish Fisheries Museum stands by the harbour in the heart of the Neuk fishing towns of - Crail centre of local crab and lobster fishing - St Monans, where wooden fishing boats are still builts and - Pittenweem, the present home of the East Neuk fleet. It is housed in a group of buildings of historic and architectural interest around 4 sides of a cobbled courtyard and illustrates every aspect of the Scottish Fishing Industry. You can see an Aquarium Room with a large collection of fish caught in Scottish waters, a display of model vessels and the interior of a fisherman's home around 1900. The courtyard has a few small wooden boats and a collection of nets and anchors. The museum is proud to have obtained 2 real fishing boats - a "Zulu" and a "Fifie" which they are restoring now.
